result.execSummary:
The defendant June Marie Hicks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. June Marie Hicks is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • June Marie Hicks was found guilty of Theft-Business Setting-Special Facts [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • June Marie Hicks was found guilty of Theft-Business Setting-Special Facts [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • June Marie Hicks was found guilty of Theft-Business Setting-Special Facts [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • June Marie Hicks was found guilty of Theft-Business Setting-Special Facts [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • June Marie Hicks was found guilty of Theft-Business Setting-Special Facts [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • June Marie Hicks was found guilty of Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 
-In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes: $79,619.10 restitution to be taken from prison wages and any remaining balance to be collected through DOC as a condition of extended supervision.

$268.00 to be taken from prison wages and any remaining balance to be collected through DOC as a condition of extended supervision.
$250.00 DNA sample to be taken from prison wages and any remaining balance to be collected through DOC as a condition of extended supervision.
$10167.20 costs (under WI. Statute 973.06) to St. Croix County Sheriff's Office to be taken from prison wages and any balance to be collected through DOC as a condition of extended supervision.

It is hereby ordered, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, M. Weckworth.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
*Maintain mental health treatment. 
*Complete an AODA
*Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
*Maintain employment. Def must NOT be employed in any care giving profession.
*Submit DNA sample

Caplan arues. DE makes a statement. Court authorizes the release of the $50,000 restitution to M. Weckworth.

Conditions of extended supervision:
- DE is to pay restitution in the amt. of $79,619.10
- DE is to reimburse the SCSO in the amt. of $10,167.20
- DE is to NOT maintain employment in any care giving profession.
- DE is to maintain employment.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- DE to maintain mental health treatment. 
- AODA
- DE to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, M. Weckworth, House Calls, and any other guardian that may be named.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person. 
DE is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Court notes no credit.
Court revokes bail and DE is remanded.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. Assistant Atty. General Amber L Hahn DF ATTY: Allan Hart Caplan DF: June Marie Hicks appeared. Case called at 10:19. Set for sentencing hearing. Court reviews file. Court rec'd a motion from the state requesting to vacate the pleas and reinstate the original charges. DE has failed to pay the $50,000 in restitution by sentencing. Assistant Atty. General updates the court and requests not to vacate the pleas today but requests to vacate the plea agreement. Atty. Caplan responds. DE has a $10,000 check to sign over today and requests another 90 days for DE to meet agreement. Court accepts the offer of proof and the acknowledgement of Atty. Caplan that DE has not met the agreement. Court finds the payment of $50,000 has not been met. DE has breached the plea agreement. Court will not proceed to vacating the plea at this time. Money should be held at this time in the clerks office until the Aug. sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. AAG: Amber L Hahn DF ATTY: Allan Hart Caplan DF: June Marie Hicks appeared. Case called at 10:04. AAG Hahn updates the court. Atty. Caplan.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 18  in 14CF545. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 18 in 14CF545. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses with prejudice Ct 6- 17 in 19-57. 
There is restitution owing of $129,619.10 with $50,000 to be paid on or before the sentencing date. In addition $10,832.97 is owed to the St. Croix County Sheriff's Dept.  Court orders a PSI, it will not include the compass risk assessment or bar graphs associated with the compass risk.  Bond continues in form and amount. Address and phone number confirmed. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Mark W. or his current guardian.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

- DE not to travel out of the US without permission of the court. 

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
